definition: erhua variant of 女孩[nu:3 hai2]

sentences.english: Miss Liu is talking with some girl in your classroom.
sentences.chinese: 劉老師正在你們班和某個女孩兒談話。

sentences.english: Good girls tend to be homebodies.
sentences.chinese: 好女孩兒通常有很強的家庭觀念。

sentences.english: The oval frames work best on gals with strong jaw or a square face.
sentences.chinese: 橢圓形鏡架最適合下巴線條硬朗或是方臉的女孩兒。

sentences.english: She was a clever child, and the other girls loved to listen to her.
sentences.chinese: 她腦瓜兒很聰明，別的女孩兒都愛聽她講故事。

sentences.english: The little girl saw her birthday presents and broke into a smile.
sentences.chinese: 這個小女孩兒看到生日禮物破顏笑了。

sentences.english: Blown girl hair short skirt, Xiao Ling Tong shoes thin clothing.
sentences.chinese: 吹得女孩兒髮長裙短，小齡童衣單鞋薄。

sentences.english: As a student in London, I shared a flat with a Moslem girl.
sentences.chinese: 在倫敦讀書的時候，我跟一個穆斯林的女孩兒一起住。

sentences.english: Under the hot lights, my bad girl side really came out.
sentences.chinese: 在熱情的燈光下，壞女孩兒的一面充分地展露出來了。

sentences.english: Yiyi is a very beautiful girl.
sentences.chinese: 依依是一個非常漂亮的女孩兒。

sentences.english: The girl lost weight and she was so happy.
sentences.chinese: 這個女孩兒變瘦了，她非常高興。

sentences.english: With hours of smudge-proof, just-picked perfection, you'll be the prettiest bloom in the bunch!
sentences.chinese: 染上這令人愉悅的深粉色，你就是最美的花樣女孩兒。

sentences.english: Ugly guys don't get the girl, even if they're devoted and awesome.
sentences.chinese: 即使醜男又真心又牛屄，他們也搞不上女孩兒。

definition: It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
so much/this much/how much?/this way/like this
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
